step_of_the_day.title:
Step of the Day:
            Recover from your stresses and hassles today. Take control over the activation of your nervous system by
            recovering after each stress (Pillar #4)
step_of_the_day.content:
“Stress is not necessarily bad, as long as you make sure to recover from it\" Stephen SideroffThere are stresses that can be considered “good\" stresses, such as getting a promotion or having a baby.
            Hans Selye, referred to these as “eustress\". There are also stresses, referred to as distress, that can be
            particularly harmful physically. Stresses that you don’t feel in control over, stresses that are dangerous
            and stresses that are chronic are negative stresses. All stresses activate your nervous system.It’s possible to cope well with all stresses. The important way of optimal coping is to a. remember to
            disengage from the stress after it’s over, and b. to engage in a recovery process.When a stress is over it’s important to consciously tell yourself, you are now safe and can relax.Recovery is facilitated by taking a few minutes to practice a relaxation exercise.

action_step:
Notice the stresses in your life today. Make a conscious effort to let go when each stress is over – saying,
            “The stress and any associated dangers are over. I am safe for the moment and can let down my guard and
            relax. Next, take between 5 and 15 minutes to engage in a relaxation/breathing/visualization exercise. You
            can go to my website: www.DrStephenSIderoff.com to download a free audio exercise.
journal_entry: Write about how well you let go after a stress is over.
